intro: Dasyglossum flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered dasyglossum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Dasyglossum flavescens is often found in disturbed areas and can be a common sight in certain regions of its native range.
